messages.title: Feeling the squeeze?
messages.content: Like you, Greens believe our money shouldn't be spent on banks & foreign wars

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A full programme of locally accessible services, by opposing cuts, closures and privatisation; free dental care, providing an NHS dentist for everyone; a fair deal for those needing health care
Preventing the further erosion of civil liberties; scrapping the costly replacement of Trident nuclear weapons; no illegal wars

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A fair deal for older people
keyPolicies.policyDescription: A basic pension for all of £170 per week; free care and support for older people living independently at home, in sheltered or extra-care housing or in residential care; a fair deal for carers and those working in social care

4,000 new jobs for Brighton and Hove in sectors including public transport, social care, housebuilding and green industries; support for Brighton’s creative industries; support for local businesses to prevent redundancies

issues.health: A full programme of locally accessible services, by opposing cuts, closures and privatisation; free dental care, providing an NHS dentist for everyone; a fair deal for those needing health care
issues.socialWelfare: A basic pension for all of £170 per week; free care and support for older people living independently at home, in sheltered or extra-care housing or in residential care; a fair deal for carers and those working in social care

images.caption: Caroline Lucas with supporters and members of the community

leaflet.additionalNotes: Published and promoted by Chris Todd on behalf of Caroline Lucas (Green Party) both at 39-41 Surrey St, Brighton, BN1 3PB. Printed on 100% recycled paper by Dennis, Conway St, Hove.
